page.title: 15FARMING AROUND AMMANFORD
page.content: Farming is very successful in the study area. Most farms are dairy units, allowing their herds to graze on the valley bottom. The mild winters mean that cattle need only be kept indoors for about 16 weeks in winter. The animals are fed on hay, silage and bought cake during these months. (Although there are no feed mills in this immediate area, there are several found locally.) The average herd is of 60 cattle, with 40 milkers. The most popular herds are Guernsey, Jersey, Friesian or Dairy-Shorthorn cross. The milk is mostly sold to a Co-op. although several farmers still sell and deliver their own green top milk. Very few sheep are found in this lowland area in summer but flocks are tacked in winter. The largest mart is at Carmarthen, about 18 miles away.
